website_summaries.verdict: An affordable book that is a great way for current graphic designers to challenge themselves and sharpen their skills.
pros: Features 80 different timed creative challenges with different forms of media to help graphic designers continue to grow and expand their skills
Also includes design examples for each challenge and tips for brainstorming
cons: Not ideal for those who do not already have a background in graphic design

customer_reviews.title: A wide variety of exercises to create a regular discipline of self-development.
customer_reviews.text: This book is great at forcing you to move outside of the way you normally work to embrace something different. It might be helpful for designers and artists to look at this book as something that requires discipline to get the most out of it. That means you’ll have to make a commitment to working the projects and then set aside regular time in your schedule to do so. That’s not always in the wheel house of some artistic temperaments but if you make the commitment and follow through, it will be worth the effort. In fact, giving artists a foundation for regular self-development may be the best benefit of this book.
customer_reviews.author: William Brown

customer_reviews.title: Some useful insights in creativity work in design.
customer_reviews.text: This is not my field of design (the book is more related to graphic design) but it had interesting tools that I can apply to my work. I got to make at last my personal logo :D!. Beyond that I read the book just making some mental resolutions of the design and comparing them to the examples developed by the participants. I have to confess many of them were quite specific and a bit boring as, then again, they are not related to my work. But I am happy to have read the whole book: it is useful. In the visual aspect the design seems a bit dated, and I include in this appreciation the cover of the book too.
customer_reviews.author: Reinold F.

customer_reviews.title: Great book. Reminds me of taking art classes in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Reminds me of taking art classes in college. This book forces you to do projects that you may not be comfortable with but will increase your artistic skills. Beautiful book.
customer_reviews.author: John Shpati

customer_reviews.title: This book has may good tools that can be used to generate ideas in ...
customer_reviews.text: This book has may good tools that can be used to generate ideas in an ideation workshop. Reader will find it handy and practical.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Creative Workshop: 80 Challenges to Sharpen Your Design Skills
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of in-house design for marketing material production. Since I work in-house, I regularly do "similar" work and wanted to grow my abilities and learn some new things. This book offers a nice change of pace and offers projects to make you better at designing and applying new concepts to your current work. The "Challenges" are a nice balance of fun and difficulty, whose end result can nicely expand a portfolio with a variety of work.
customer_reviews.author: A.Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Book In Every Way
customer_reviews.text: Excellemt book!! Thorough, easy to follow and it addresses both technical aspects and the mental ups and downs of graphic design.
customer_reviews.author: SquirrelGurl

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very informative. I learn some techniques that really help with my graphics design skills
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As a Design Teacher this is a great resource for those kids that tend to move a ...
customer_reviews.text: As a Design Teacher this is a great resource for those kids that tend to move a little quicker than their peers!
customer_reviews.author: Monte

customer_reviews.title: Great Design Exercises! Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I am really liking this book. It gives you concrete exercises in design, which are timed, which really makes them more effective as each exercise must be COMPLETED in a short time. I have learned a lot doing these exercises and would like to buy a Volume 2 of this book!! I highly recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Adore Yourself

customer_reviews.title: Amazing book for anyone looking to help channel their creativity
customer_reviews.text: Amazing teachers aid. I used this book in my GD classes and it was a huge help, both to me and my students. HIGHLY recommended for anyone looking how to channel their creativity.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great mental workout, you can do the challenges daily, or weekly, or whenever, but they're a nice workout to get your creative juices flowing. Don't expect to change the world with every project, but you'll see a noticeable difference between your first project and your last project, as far as quality, quantity, functionality, concept, etc. It's just a great book.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Pedreros

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT DESIGN RESOURCE
customer_reviews.text: As a designer and educator for over 20 years, I was energized and impressed with the quality and beauty of this valuable resource. I will be utilizing the ideas in my classroom and with my design team. I highly recommend this book to anyone with a passion for design and in search of creative solutions!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift seems like a very well done book with practical and applicable ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift seems like a very well done book with practical and applicable knowledge for graphic designers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Up for the Challenge?
customer_reviews.text: I have found this book to be a wonderful tool. Whether I need a warm-up before a client project or need some new ideas for a personal project, 'Creative Workshop' helps give me a running start. Beautifully and simply laid out, the book is easy to follow. I especially enjoyed seeing the samples of other designers' takes on the challenges. The workshops truly made my brain think outside of the box! I highly recommend this book for beginner and advanced designers alike.
customer_reviews.author: Junryou

customer_reviews.title: nice resource
customer_reviews.text: Fun. Keeps me busy on rainy days. Really great for stretching your creative muscles and challenging yourself to think differently about common tasks and problems, and some not so common ones.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: good Condition
customer_reviews.text: Edges were bent a little but great overall for price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my daughter, a designer, for Christmas. She loved it. This would be especially useful for anyone who feels stuck on a given project and wants to break their own logjam.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mcknight

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a kick start!
customer_reviews.text: As an instructional designer, I am always looking for discoveries in design. This book went in a different direction than I anticipated, but it's been so much fun playing with the projects. I can't wait to use some of the exercises with my team.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Marrapodi

customer_reviews.title: I love this book
customer_reviews.text: I love this book! It's great for graphic designers who want to stay on top of things and need more materials for their portfolio.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Anabel

customer_reviews.title: I like what I see
customer_reviews.text: I have just started going through this book, but I already like the layout of the lessons. The time limits on them are a good idea for simulating real work, but I wish there were some comments/instructions about what I should do if I run out of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea Book for the Graphics/Tech Teacher
customer_reviews.text: Lots of awesome ideas in this book for projects to do with your students. You can even think of new ideas based on the projects in the book. I look forward to using the ideas and have shared the book with two other people already.
customer_reviews.author: wmg

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: This was so fun to dive into. If you're looking for a way to creatively practice your skills I highly recommend this. I only regret not getting a physical copy.
customer_reviews.author: Missy R

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Exellent book to keep your designer skills on shape. Just by taking one every other day you keep your inner designer sharp. I loved the different activities and challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Anandamide

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A really fun book. Lots of different exercises to do. Many of which would look great on portfolios.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett Holt

customer_reviews.title: I'm thoroughly satisfied with the item
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived in reasonable time. I'm thoroughly satisfied with the item.
customer_reviews.author: Edith A. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Good fun, creative inspiration
customer_reviews.text: If you take the time to actually do these activities, the book is worth every penny. Definitely gets your mind working and builds up your creativity skills.. Fun to do in groups as well as alone!
customer_reviews.author: DeucesWild

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I read through all of the projects and really like most of them.I am glad that each project comes with example images. They are really helpful! Highly recommended for anyone creating a portfolio and need some good ideas on what to put in it or for someone who wants to practice their design skills.
customer_reviews.author: Solo Artist

customer_reviews.title: Creative Workshop is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: What a great book. I bought it hoping to get some PBL idea for my graphics classes and a fresh look at graphics, typography, and branding idenity. This book has it and it's appropriate for high school and beyond. I plan on working some of the exercises just to keep sharp and keep my creative juices flowing. Each project is written in a concise manner and I love the quotes. Plus, with each project/exercise you get a challenge, the author terms it "Take it Further." You won't be disappointed by this author and David Sherwin's writing style is easy and enjoyable to read. This book is a home run!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CraftyNWAGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great For Managers of Creative Teams!
customer_reviews.text: My sole reason for purchasing this book was to find ways to inject some new life into the Creative Services department of which I am a member and manager. I feel confident that I found the right book for the right job.
customer_reviews.author: Misderstand

customer_reviews.title: Good book - helpful with a good structure
customer_reviews.text: Fun and creative, well structured and can be very useful to keep yourself in motion with your creativity
customer_reviews.author: lele7design

customer_reviews.title: A must have Design book!
customer_reviews.text: Anyone who does Design, truly can benefit from this book!The challenges in it keep you on your toes!
customer_reviews.author: S.E.Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wish the projects were better.
customer_reviews.text: The projects are lame and the examples they use aren't the best either. I want to look at award winning designs, not stuff that was thrown together for the sake of a project. Some examples are really good, others are just not cutting it. Project wise, it still has essentials that you should know and helps you practice for them.... BUT they just dont feel fun, wish they had less story and more stricter deadlines too.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Biden

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift Idea for Designers
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great gift idea for designers. I bought this as a gift for my logo designer and he loved it. It gives some exercises to help build your base of skills for logo development.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: A helping hand for designers' block
customer_reviews.text: One of my mentor faves book, she used this book whenever we were stuck for ideas. Get this one and use it as often as you can!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah-Jane

customer_reviews.title: Real design
customer_reviews.text: It's an amazing book that doesn't teach but helps to start to think as designer. Every new challenge trains the brain to solve easy any new problem. Sort of 'must have' books!
customer_reviews.author: Stas

customer_reviews.title: Helpful Design Workbook
customer_reviews.text: This book is helpful for the the person who wants to sharpen their skills. I really enjoyed doing the challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The book should be named "80 exercises", the word "challenge" isn't quite accurate...
customer_reviews.text: The book is great for small exercises, and I imagine it would be an instant solutions for artist's block. However, I was drawn to the word "challenges". I wanted to see great work from skilled artists, not finished work that was thrown together specifically for the book. Even though I'm somewhat disappointed, I'm glad I bought this book and I think it'll be a great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Malloryyy

customer_reviews.title: Graphic Design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas. He has been using this book to brush up on his graphic design skills. Loves it!
customer_reviews.author: jojobee

customer_reviews.title: Very usefull!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it is very difficult to get started with a new design proyect. This book shows many ways to accomplish that. Some ideas may suit you more than others; you only need to try and see which one is right for you. If you are a designer or design student you know how hard it is. I didn't do all the exercises yet, but it seems promising. A good way to train your creativity when you have an approaching dead line and no proyect!
customer_reviews.author: Catalina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book for those shifting careers or rekindling a love of graphic design.
customer_reviews.text: It's jam packed with exercises reminiscent of those college days only with more. The samples are interesting, the exercises concise and very clear. You take away what ever you put into this book and if you approach it that way, it's sure to reward you. Keep in mind that this is for a self disciplined person because it does you no good to "read-ahead" toward the next exercise. This book teaches you how to think faster and with restrictions ( what you encounter in the real world). The only suggestion to the author, include a chapter on how to specifically generate / concept ideas.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosSays

customer_reviews.title: This will serve me well.
customer_reviews.text: I am not so creative, and that is where this book comes in. It challenges your creativity. A friend swears by it!
customer_reviews.author: kstars

customer_reviews.title: GREAT IDEAS!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this book yesterday (bought it 10/12/13). I cracked the seal and flipped through the pages. Awesome!!!!! The projects in there are awesome. Good for those who lost the connection with graphic design due to career changes, and want to beef up their portfolio. I absoulutely love the challenges. Def. recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Donte Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great book for sharpening your skills
customer_reviews.text: Full of great ways to get better at your job :) I just need more free time to get into more of the tutorials.
customer_reviews.author: OhioM

customer_reviews.title: Lots of exciting exercise.
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely helpful book in helping you thinking creatively. The exercise are challenging yet fun. I am enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Leilamodel

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: This book gives me the simple instruction and clear focus. It is easy to use this book. I have had a good training to design with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun book to have around.
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting book that will challenge anybody and any level of expertise.
customer_reviews.author: Srdjan Marjanovic

customer_reviews.title: Not finished but really happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have been in the graphic design business for 35 years and find this book to be a wonderful approach to stretch your design capabilities. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: BBCS

customer_reviews.title: great graphic design book
customer_reviews.text: My bf is getting his degree in graphic design and he says its a great book to have around the house.
customer_reviews.author: sweetlyvillainous

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my graphic designer bf for his birthday. He LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT. FILLED WITH IMAGINATION AND EXAMPLES AND EXCERCISES
customer_reviews.text: I am self teaching myself how to be a graphic designer and finding my own voice. THis book is much more difficult if your not in school as a graphic design student or your already graduated. However, i bought this book anyways to get my ideas going. It really gave me a good understanding of the concepts in the bigger picture. the exercises are truly challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzychaos

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This book would help out with my portfolio to summit to portfolio school.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert R Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Well written workshop book
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Just like taking a design class. I wish it said a bit more about software, however. That would be very helpful. Overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Colin B Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: There are so many amazing design challenges in this book! They all have time limits, though, so if you're a beginner Graphic Designer like me, keeping up with that might not be possible. I just love being able to have good ideas for creating new things for my portfolio! I would recommend this book to every beginner Graphic Designer out there!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh-Anne Drago

customer_reviews.title: Awesome graphics
customer_reviews.text: Christmas came early for me this year! As I start my journey into the world of UI and UX dev/design this book is going to serve as a motivator to massage my creativity. Just from flipping through I am confident I have made a valuable investment. Not to mention all of the reviews are also positive!
customer_reviews.author: MajG

customer_reviews.title: Is more for a teacher or if you are the ones who like to do some design task by your own is perfect !!
customer_reviews.text: Inside you will find many tasks about design , from the most manual arts to more technics stuff , is really fun if you want to interacts with your kids !!
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Rodriguez Cerezo

customer_reviews.title: rainbow creative train
customer_reviews.text: great book excellent condition great ideas and a great project starter it gets the creative moving I really enjoy this book
customer_reviews.author: lakeytria

customer_reviews.title: Projects and Exercises
customer_reviews.text: The book has projects but as a teacher I was looking for short projects for students. I am not returning the book as it does have several good ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Must have for design teachers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for graphic designs projects for my high school students!!
customer_reviews.author: Marian Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great challenges! Helps me to think and brainstorm more about what I'm designing.
customer_reviews.text: The challenges are great if you're a new designer and want to help yourself get better or keep your creativity flowing while you look for jobs. However, BUY THE ACTUAL BOOK IF YOU'RE THINKING ABOUT BUYING THIS. The ebook or kindle book looks like old crappy html, just spend the extra few dollars and get the physical printed object please
customer_reviews.author: Kayla N. Harris

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I think that a real designer must know not only what he wants to say in his book, but how it should look. This is a good example. All in one - creative, beautiful, interesting, funny and well designed. I enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Best part of my day is doing a new project
customer_reviews.text: Can't get enough of this book!! Best part of my day is doing a new project!!
customer_reviews.author: LilBeeb90

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Book!
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for getting creative juices flowing! I so look forward to doing all the projects in this book! Great book for creatives!
customer_reviews.author: Lise Elder

customer_reviews.title: Helpful book with some good exercises. Some are time-consuming, however.
customer_reviews.text: Great exercises and a nice book. You'll need to allot quite a bit of time to complete them, however.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Musgrove

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Informative.
customer_reviews.text: This is great book that really helps you hone your creative skills. It reminiscent of those little 2nd grade paper back work books-- except for adults. I use the phrase work book because that's, really what it is. It's full of creative activities that put your creative juices to work. I purchased this book out of curiosity and also it was on the recommended for you list. I'm glad I did, it's a style conscious, high quality book that is just plain old fun.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Creative instructions for the creative mind.
customer_reviews.text: Very practical. Keeps your creative juices flowing. Challenging and enriching. It forces you to think outside the box, like such a book should.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Straight to the main points! No beating around the bush. A must have for any creative out there looking to improve their creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Felipe Ospina

customer_reviews.title: great help
customer_reviews.text: fabulous book and great concept it has helped me with my graphic designcourse, that's for sure would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: Great condition and a great find! Very helpful to think outside the box when working on a graphic design project. Many projects to work on and to add to your portfolio. I would recommend this to any designer.
customer_reviews.author: Laura K

customer_reviews.title: great exercises for designers and creative teams
customer_reviews.text: This book is a very smart collection of exercises you can use with creative teams. Very well written and extremely practical.
customer_reviews.author: andrina valdes

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book to stay creative and sharp after finishing college and it is very good. Challenges are a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Useful stimulative or teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: A bit different approach in how-to area with some nice problem/solution examples. Good addition to any proffesional or junior broad range designers library. It won't be left unread. Just fine selection of quotes are worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Informative and fun
customer_reviews.text: A fun and informative book that can sharpen your design skills. I have also modified some of the challenges to better fit my field of landscape architecture. I can safely say they are fun and get your creative juices flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Geiri

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was less for organizating a group workshop and more for individual brainstorming methods.
customer_reviews.author: Shagane Barsegian

customer_reviews.title: very useful tool to have for those in the designing areas
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my friend who is a Graphics Designer, it has been a year now and she constantly refers to the book for inspiration and ideas, very useful tool to have for those in the designing areas! For me (non-designer) I loved all the colored pages and how well things were explained, therefore I give it a high rating
customer_reviews.author: escentialplus

customer_reviews.title: A well of inspiration
customer_reviews.text: This book is fantastic...I like the fact that it encourages you to think fast, think differently, and think creatively. Definitely a must have for students and designers alike.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just too broad of a spectrum to use in a class room. Covers too many venues.
customer_reviews.author: Kb

customer_reviews.title: Great refresher and exercise workbook
customer_reviews.text: Great Brain trainer. Uses great exercises to get past mental blocks for all types of artists and creatives.
customer_reviews.author: David Beltran

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this but my copy is missing the first 25 pages. Check your copy carefully.
customer_reviews.author: TimAndCandice

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this book
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a book that has exercises to get your creative juices flowing, this is the book for you. Have you ever had a deadline and every attempt at that perfect design was a personal flop? This book gets you to look outside of the box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Heintz

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat misleading
customer_reviews.text: Having suffered a loss of creativity, I bought this book in the hopes that it would help me get that creative spark back and improve my overall skill. It helped, and in general had some good ideas, but it didn't really help solve the underlying problems. Honestly, I'd buy it used if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good to brush up on ur skills
customer_reviews.text: Love this book, it helped me keep brushed up on my design skills while on maternity leave.
customer_reviews.author: shelby best

customer_reviews.title: The creative workshop
customer_reviews.text: I have found this book to be an inspiration both in terms of idea generation and design output. This book would be invaluable to a studio wishing to experiment with design ideas to showcase their clients. I intend to work through these challenges and am confident my design and thought process will improve beacuse of it!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cannings

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: The book was arrived on time. Bought it for self improvements. Good examples and exercises. Love to do the exercises!
customer_reviews.author: Bluesuiter

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Not the best buy, I purchased this book by mistake for $16 thinking it was similar to another visual design book i returned it only to get $2.45 back Awful Amazon
customer_reviews.author: sherly

customer_reviews.title: Excelente
customer_reviews.text: Um título que poderia ser traduzido para português. Excelente para quem está cursando design gráfico e tem interesse em entrar no mercado. Recomendo!
customer_reviews.author: Felipe Ribeiro da Silva

customer_reviews.title: Really neat book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic design student and I recently gave this as a gift to a friend of mine who is graduating. She almost didn't get it because I wanted to keep it for myself! Very cool book, lots of fun ways to get your creative juices flowing. I'd highly recommend it for other graphic designers.
customer_reviews.author: BDouglas

customer_reviews.title: a colorful book with design details
customer_reviews.text: There are many design cases in this book, some hand-painted pictures, short text. I think it is easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Li Shuangshuang

customer_reviews.title: Creative Ideas
customer_reviews.text: For the lovers of creativity this book shows you the steps to creat a creative design starting from the simple sketches and developing it all the way along till the final result.
customer_reviews.author: Fatma

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design in kindle format
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to make this book look weel designed, much of content on first page of each chapter is cut off.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it if you are using iPad.
customer_reviews.text: *I am only reviewing for its format, NOT CONTENT* This kindle version is not optimized for iPad version. Some exercises require you to read text on images but it was impossible to read any text without with low resolution images.
customer_reviews.author: MLD C

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive book
customer_reviews.text: How such an ugly book can be about design and inspire people? Not an inspirational book is the least I could say... 1 star for the quantity of information and one star cause I'm sure it's been a lot of work to write this book anyway!
customer_reviews.author: alessandra

customer_reviews.title: Totally misleading title
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend this book to anybody, who knows anything about design. Probably the worse book that I bought last year.
customer_reviews.author: Mobile UI designer
